Key Match Events: Brazil defeated Chile 2-1 on Thursday as an 89th-minute winner sealed all three points and moved the Selecao up to fourth in the CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying table.
Chile scored after just two minutes with a sensational headed effort from veteran attacker Eduardo Vargas.
Just before the half-time break, Selecao striker Igor Jesus headed home to draw the visitors level, with a pinpoint cross from Manchester City winger Savinho.
Brazil made it 2-1 after 89 minutes with a low-driven effort into the bottom-left corner by Luiz Henrique.
Post-Match Reflections: The three points will come as a welcome relief to head coach Dorival Junior but it was a poor showing from Brazil.
The pressure on the manager is now only likely to increase after such a disjointed performance.
